section.title: Usage
section.para: This is a plugin providing Beauty beautifiers by running the external clang-format http://clang.llvm.org tool. The clang-format tool must be installed before using this plugin! Details for downloading and installing this tool can be found at http://llvm.org/releases/download.html. The clang tools are available for Windows, Mac, Linux, and BSD
clang-format supports C, C++, and Objective-C.

To activate clang-format from within jEdit:
open the plugin options (Plugins / Plugin Options),
go to the Beauty > Modes pane,
choose clang-format for C, C++, and Objective-C modes.
Now, run Plugins > Beauty > Beautify Buffer.
See the Beauty plugin documentation for addtional details for setting keyboard shortcuts.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: This plugin is configured via the CLangBeauty option pane. Go to Plugins - Plugin Options - CLangBeauty to configure.
The path to clang-format executable is set through the clangbeauty.clang-format property. This must be done for jEdit to be able to find the clang-format executable.
You may select a style option for clang-format to use. The choices are LLVM, Google, Chromium, Mozilla, and WebKit. At this time, these are the only options available.
